# INAppendToNoteIntent

**Class**

A request to append content to a note.

## Declaration

```swift
class INAppendToNoteIntent
```

## Overview

Siri creates an [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INAppendToNoteIntent] object when the user asks to append content to an existing note. The intent object contains the note to modify and the content to add to the note.

To handle this intent, the handler object in your Intents extension must adopt the [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INAppendToNoteIntentHandling] protocol. Your handler should confirm the request and create an [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INAppendToNoteIntentResponse] object with the updated note.

### Additional Intent Attributes

The following table lists additional attributes of this intent object:



If the resolution for any parameter requires disambiguation or confirmation, the user must unlock the device before you handle the intent. If resolution of the parameters doesn’t require user interaction, you can handle the intent without the user unlocking the device.

## Initializing the Intent Object

- **init(targetNote:content:)**: Initializes the intent object with the specified note and content.

## Getting the Note Content

- **content**: The content to append to the note.
- **targetNote**: The note to receive the additional content.

## Note Additions

- **INAppendToNoteIntentHandling**: The handler interface for appending content to a note.
- **INAppendToNoteIntentResponse**: Your app’s response to a request to append content to a note.

## Inherits From

- INIntent

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- INIntentSetImageKeyPath
- NSCoding
- NSCopying
- NSObjectProtocol
- NSSecureCoding
